text: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, for the sake of the faith of God's elect and their knowledge of the truth, which accords with godliness,
speaker: Narrator

text: in hope of eternal life, which God, who never lies, promised before the ages began
speaker: Narrator

text: and at the proper time manifested in his word through the preaching with which I have been entrusted by the command of God our Saviour;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Titus, my true child in a common faith:
Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is why I left you in Crete, so that you might put what remained into order, and appoint elders in every town as I directed you—
speaker: Narrator

text: if anyone is above reproach, the husband of one wife, and his children are believers and not open to the charge of debauchery or insubordination.
speaker: Narrator

text: For an overseer, as God's steward, must be above reproach. He must not be arrogant or quick-tempered or a drunkard or violent or greedy for gain,
speaker: Narrator

text: but hospitable, a lover of good, self-controlled, upright, holy, and disciplined.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must hold firm to the trustworthy word as taught, so that he may be able to give instruction in sound doctrine and also to rebuke those who contradict it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there are many who are insubordinate, empty talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision party.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must be silenced, since they are upsetting whole families by teaching for shameful gain what they ought not to teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the Cretans, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This testimony is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: not devoting themselves to Jewish myths and the commands of people who turn away from the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the pure, all things are pure, but to the defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their minds and their consciences are defiled.
speaker: Narrator

text: They profess to know God, but they deny him by their works. They are detestable, disobedient, unfit for any good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, teach what accords with sound doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Older men are to be sober-minded, dignified, self-controlled, sound in faith, in love, and in steadfastness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Older women likewise are to be reverent in behaviour, not slanderers or slaves to much wine. They are to teach what is good,
speaker: Narrator

text: and so train the young women to love their husbands and children,
speaker: Narrator

text: to be self-controlled, pure, working at home, kind, and submissive to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be reviled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise, urge the younger men to be self-controlled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Show yourself in all respects to be a model of good works, and in your teaching show integrity, dignity,
speaker: Narrator

text: and sound speech that cannot be condemned, so that an opponent may be put to shame, having nothing evil to say about us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slaves are to be submissive to their own masters in everything; they are to be well-pleasing, not argumentative,
speaker: Narrator

text: not pilfering, but showing all good faith, so that in everything they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation for all people,
speaker: Narrator

text: training us to renounce ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright, and godly lives in the present age,
speaker: Narrator

text: waiting for our blessed hope, the appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: who gave himself for us to redeem us from all lawlessness and to purify for himself a people for his own possession who are zealous for good works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare these things; exhort and rebuke with all authority. Let no one disregard you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remind them to be submissive to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,
speaker: Narrator

text: to speak evil of no one, to avoid quarrelling, to be gentle, and to show perfect courtesy towards all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we ourselves were once foolish, disobedient, led astray, slaves to various passions and pleasures, passing our days in malice and envy, hated by others and hating one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the goodness and loving kindness of God our Saviour appeared,
speaker: Narrator

text: he saved us, not because of works done by us in righteousness, but according to his own mercy, by the washing of regeneration and renewal of the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: whom he poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Saviour,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that being justified by his grace we might become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: The saying is trustworthy, and I want you to insist on these things, so that those who have believed in God may be careful to devote themselves to good works. These things are excellent and profitable for people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But avoid foolish controversies, genealogies, dissensions, and quarrels about the law, for they are unprofitable and worthless.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for a person who stirs up division, after warning him once and then twice, have nothing more to do with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing that such a person is warped and sinful; he is self-condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do your best to speed Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way; see that they lack nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let our people learn to devote themselves to good works, so as to help cases of urgent need, and not be unfruitful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who are with me send greetings to you. Greet those who love us in the faith.
Grace be with you all.
speaker: Narrator
